title: Understanding Measures of Central Tendency
text: Measures of central tendency describe the center of a data set. Common examples include mean, median, and mode.

title: Identifying the Odd One Out
text: Think about which option does not describe the center of a data set but rather the spread or range of values.

title: Defining the Range
text: The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values in a data set. It measures the spread, not the center.
